documents.document: My friend Kristi Trimmer just asked a question on Facebook, “What do you miss?” I don’t know if it is because I’m totally relaxed and ready for bed or the heart to heart conversation I just had with the love of my life, but as soon as I read Kristi’s question a flood of things... Read More...

“What do you miss?” That’s the question I asked myself last month and my answers surprised me. Almost all the things on my list were things I didn’t really have to be missing. They were things I was missing because I’d let other things take priority in my life and I hadn’t stopped to notice... Read More...

This past spring, I weighed 312 pounds and I’m a complete and total head case about it. There, I said it. (We’ll see if I publish it.) I’ve been heavy, seriously heavy, for most of my adult life. I was overweight when we started our family and gained about 30 pounds with each of our... Read More...

Now that I’ve bared my soul, shared my fears, and told you what wasn’t working, let’s to celebrate what is working. It’s crazy to me how similar so many of us are in our thinking and self image. It’s sad too. Reading your comments, Facebook messages, emails, and talking with some of you in person made... Read More...

I promised I’d update my progress every week. I weighed in yesterday morning and was down 3.8 lbs, 42.4 pounds total. Good news, but what do you do when you find yourself in a position of having two opposing goals? Which one wins? I’ve been on this weight loss journey since May, slowly increasing my commitment... Read More...
